text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the author sets, fixes, or legally approves the public retail price under French law. The candidate answer explicitly states the opposite: \"In practice: the **publisher sets the retail price**... So your \u201clegal margin\u201d is mostly **contractual negotiation**, not a default statutory right.\" While it discusses negotiating approval, it correctly identifies that the default legal position under French fixed-price rules is that the publisher sets the price, thus failing to confirm the premise of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "a4b9ac1f-ad65-4795-8621-04e72c36c1f3"}
